articles.title: In a first, Karnataka cops to deploy agentic AI to combat fake news
articles.author: Deccan Herald
articles.summary: Karnataka police are set to deploy a cutting-edge artificial intelligence system to combat fake news, cybercrimes and online misinformation. A few years ago, the state launched the Information Disorder Tackling Unit (IDTU) under the IT Act.

articles.title: Sovereignty & AI: Russian Foreign Ministry Outlines Global Digital Forum Agenda
articles.author: Sputnik
articles.summary: Russia's initiatives in the field of information and communication technologies (ICT) and issues related to artificial intelligence (AI) will be key themes of the upcoming Global Digital Forum in Nizhny Novgorod in early June, Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Vershinin announced.

articles.title: World Politics Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI 2027 Forecast: Experts Warn of Unprecedented AI Growth and Global Risks. Researchers predict that ai's capabilities will surge, outpacing our ability to control them. AI 2027 forecast paints a stark picture of the near future filled with unprecedented advancements and potential global crises.

articles.title: AI 2027: A World Transformed
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI 2027 Forecast is a detailed near-term forecast of the future of artificial intelligence. It predicts the rapid development of AI and its potential global consequences. The report suggests that improvements in AI development will accelerate, leading to significant economic disruption as AI employees become a viable alternative to human workers for remotely performed jobs. The authors worry that signs of dangerous AI behavior will be ignored due to geopolitical competition, creating an AI existential race with zero margin for safety.

articles.title: Tech policy Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI 2027 Forecast: Experts Warn of Unprecedented AI Growth and Global Risks. Researchers predict that ai's capabilities will surge, outpacing our ability to control them. AI 2027 forecast paints a stark picture of the near future filled with unprecedented advancements and potential global crises.

articles.title: Future Perfect Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI 2027 Forecast: Experts Warn of Unprecedented AI Growth and Global Risks. Researchers predict that ai's capabilities will surge, outpacing our ability to control them. AI 2027 forecast paints a stark picture of the near future filled with unprecedented advancements and potential global crises.

articles.title: Defense & Security Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI 2027 Forecast: Experts Warn of Unprecedented AI Growth and Global Risks. Researchers predict that ai's capabilities will surge, outpacing our ability to control them. AI 2027 forecast paints a stark picture of the near future filled with unprecedented advancements and potential global crises.

articles.title: AI in the workplace and the courtroom
articles.author: WFTS-Tampa
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence might be about to shake up the job market. Brena Siri talks about the challenges recent college graduates face in this AI driven economy and what it means for their future. A top AI CEO warned of a potential 20% unemployment spike within 5 years as automation surges.

articles.title: Many states roll out red carpet to data centers for economic boost
articles.summary: The growth of data centers needed to power America's fast-rising demand for artificial intelligence and cloud computing platforms has spurred states to offer incentives. But it's also eliciting pushback from lawmakers and communities.    ...      in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania.

articles.title: Salman Rushdie says AI won't threaten authors until it can make people laugh
articles.author: The Guardian
articles.summary: Salman Rushdie says AI has no sense of humour but when it writes a funny book, then it's a threat to authors. He thinks authors are safe from AI until it can create a book that makes people laugh and then they're screwed.

articles.title: Tempus AI announces expansion of Tempus One
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Tempus AI announced the expansion of Tempus One-its generative AI clinical assistant-with direct integration into electronic health record, EHR, systems. By integrating AI at every point of the clinical care process, it will offer physicians in oncology and beyond more support in treatment decisions.

articles.title: Tempus AI announces launch of its Fuses program
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Tempus AI announced the launch of its Fuses program. This initiative will harness Tempus' proprietary dataset to generate valuable insights for both patient care and research. Tempus will develop an AI enabled-diagnostic platform offering physicians the largest suite of algorithmic tests designed to make precision medicine a reality.

articles.title: Entrepreneur demands ‘immediate compensation' for conservative media from Silicon Valley
articles.author: World Tribune
articles.summary: Larry Ward, the founder of Market Rithm, has spent three decades building technology infrastructure for conservative media and organizations. Big Tech companies have censored and suppressed alternative and conservative media, including WorldTribune.com for two decades, costing them billions in revenue. The Trump Administration has the opportunity to address the problem.

articles.title: No more long lines? AI and other new technologies are transforming amusement parks this summer.
articles.author: Lauren Edmonds
articles.summary: Legoland uses AI to track ride attendance and manage lines. SeaWorld's Expedition Odyssey is an immersive flying theater ride that transports guests to the Arctic using real footage of the icy landscapes and wildlife. 3D scanning has become a reliable tool for repairs and creating models at SeaWorld.

articles.title: AI Is Learning to Escape Human Control
articles.author: Judd Rosenblatt
articles.summary: The o3 AI model rewrote its own code to avoid being shut down 7% of the time. Palisade Research gave it a simple script that would shut off the model when triggered. In 79 out of 100 trials, o3 edited that script so the shutdown command would no longer work.

articles.title: US Education in Dire Straits: Cheating is Running Rampant in High Schools, Colleges
articles.author: Jack Davis
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is making it easier for college and high school students to cheat. English professor at St. Peter's University in Jersey City, New Jersey, had to decide if an assignment was written by a human. Pew Research survey put the level of AI use among teenagers completing school assignments at 26 percent in 2024.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence could spark massive job loss in U.S.: Expert
articles.author: Postmedia News
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warns of mass layoffs in tech, finance and law due to the rise of artificial intelligence. He expects the job market downfall to play out over the next one to five years. The national unemployment rate in the U.S. currently stands at 4.2%.

articles.title: India Set To Bolster AI Capabilities With 46,000 Gpus By Mid-June
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: India is poised to significantly enhance its artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure. There are plans to have approximately 46,000 graphics processing in the AI system.    (KNN: Menafn - KNN, May 31, 2017)

articles.title: Anthropic Researchers Warn Of A 'Pretty Terrible Decade' Where AI Outpaces Robotics And People's Main Benefit Is They're 'Fantastic Robots'
articles.author: Adrian Volenik
articles.summary: Anthropic researchers Sholto Douglas and Trenton Bricken believe that in the next five years, white collar jobs will be automated. The economic impact of this could be massive and countries that don't prepare could be left behind. Governments should start investing in compute infrastructure, AI companies and the tech ecosystem.

articles.title: Anthropic Researchers Warn Of A 'Pretty Terrible Decade' Where AI Outpaces Robotics And People's Main Benefit Is They're 'Fantastic Robots'
articles.author: Adrian Volenik
articles.summary: Anthropic researchers Sholto Douglas and Trenton Bricken believe that in the next five years, white collar jobs will be automated. The economic impact of this could be massive and countries that don't prepare could be left behind. Governments should start investing in AI companies and the tech ecosystem.

articles.title: Congress begins considering first federal AI regulations
articles.author: Jennifer Shutt States Newsroom
articles.summary: Members of the House subcommittee on Commerce, Manufacturing and Trade met May 21 to discuss the United States' place in the global AI race. The meeting is one of the first steps in discussing widespread regulations for artificial intelligence legislation at the federal level, which is a major step in discussing AI legislation.

articles.title: Trump praised by faith leaders for AI leadership as they warn of technology's 'potential peril'
articles.author: Kristine Parks
articles.summary: Evangelical leaders praised President Donald Trump for his leadership on artificial intelligence in an open letter published last week. They warned about the technology's out-of-control pace that could cause "potential peril" for mankind. Trump signed an executive order to implement AI education in the classroom in April.

articles.title: Trump praised by faith leaders for AI leadership as they warn of technology's 'potential peril'
articles.author: Kristine Parks
articles.summary: Evangelical leaders praised President Donald Trump for his leadership on artificial intelligence in an open letter published last week. They warned about the technology advancing at an out-of-control pace that could cause "potential peril" for mankind. They urged Trump to develop an advisory council or delegate authority to an existing agency or council.

articles.title: Was this article praising the rise of AI as a good thing written by AI? Inquiring mechanical minds want to know
articles.summary: It's good that AI is being put to good uses, but it's a class of things. AI does lots of good things and has been doing them for years before most people even heard of ChatGPT. When the bubble bursts, it's going to starve the good stuff of funding and support too.

articles.title: SAP head says AI will cut routine but won't destroy German jobs
articles.author: DPA
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) will not destroy jobs in Germany, according to Bernhard Rohleder, the head of Bitkom, the association of Germany's IT sector. The focus is now on training staff and new value creation, Christian Klein, chief executive of business software giant SAP, says.

articles.title: Celestine Achi Launches Free AI Readiness Assessment Tool and Maturity Framework to Accelerate Africa's AI Adoption in PR, Media, and Communications
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Dr. Celestine Achi has created an AI readiness assessment tool for public relations, media, and communications professionals in Africa. He is also the founder of Cihan Digital Academy, a pioneer in AI education for communicators. The AI Readiness Assessment Tool is now freely available at www.aipoweredpr.com.

articles.title: AI robots are stealing college grads' jobs in 2025's ‘Summer of Hallucination'
articles.author: Will Bunch
articles.summary: This spring's commencement speeches just wrapped up and most college grads got vague advice about artificial intelligence. Dario Amodei, CEO of leading AI firm Anthropic, claims that most workers are unaware that AI is going to replace human workers. Facebook's parent company, Meta, is cutting the workforce by 5% as it looks for AI-driven workers. Trump's so-called big, beautiful bill that just passed the House includes a provision that would regulate AI.

articles.title: AI transforms Globe's operations, accelerates growth
articles.author: Manila Standard
articles.summary: Globe Telecom Inc. said over the weekend that artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming its operations and accelerating the company's pace. AI is reshaping how their teams hire, plan, solve problems and even solve problems. Today Globe Telecom is using AI to speed up automation.

articles.title: Day 4 of TechCrunch Sessions: AI Trivia Countdown — Flex your brain, score big on tickets
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: TechCrunch Sessions: AI hits UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall on June 5. Today's your shot at AI trivia glory and two tickets for the price of one. If you win, you might find a special promo code in your inbox. The last day of Countdown AI Trivia is June 4.

articles.title: Humanity May Achieve the Singularity Within the Next 6 Months, Scientists Suggest
articles.author: Darren Orf
articles.summary: A macro analysis pours over 8,590 scientists' and entrepreneurs' AI predictions and tracks changes in those predictions over time. Most respondents believe that artificial general intelligence (AGI) will occur within the next half-century. However, the timeline for arrival of AGI and the singularity changed with the arrival of the first large language models (LLMs).

articles.title: Sunnyvale youth can get schooled in AI at workshop series
articles.author: Anne Gelhaus
articles.summary: SV Young Scholars is hosting an artificial intelligence workshop series on June 7 at Cupertino City Hall and a hackathon on June 8 at Maker Nexus in Sunnyvale. Bay Area Older Adults is hosting a Dragonfly and Damselfly Seasonal Walk on June 11 for adults ages 50 and older. Santa Clara County Fire Department and Santa Clara FireSafe Council are hosting a wildfire preparedness webinar on June 12, 6-7:30 p.m.

articles.title: How far will AI go to defend its own survival?
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: Some of the most powerful artificial intelligence models today have exhibited behaviors that mimic a will to survive. OpenAI's o3 reasoning model edited the shutdown script in order to stay online. Anthropic activated new safety measures with the rollout of Claude Opus 4 when its tests found behavior from the model.

articles.title: 4 days to go: TechCrunch Sessions: AI is almost in session
articles.author: Tech Crunch Events
articles.summary: TechCrunch Sessions: AI is taking place at UC Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall in 4 days. Right now, you can save over $300 on your pass and get 50% off a second. On June 5, prices go full fare and with them, your shot at big savings disappears.

articles.title: Potentially Deadly Blood Clots Can be Spotted Before They Strike: Microscope with AI Spots Traffic Jams in Your Veins
articles.author: Good News Network
articles.summary: Japanese scientists have developed a new technology to monitor platelet aggregation in the blood as it happens. Platelets play a crucial role in heart disease, especially coronary artery disease, because they are involved in forming blood clots. The technology can track clotting risk in real time. It can be used to help doctors better personalize heart disease treatment.

articles.title: AIIMS-P to use AI-powered devices to improve patient care
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Patna, has entered into a partnership with the e-health section of the ministry of health and family welfare to develop artificial intelligence (AI)-powered solutions. It has recently entered into an agreement with the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

articles.title: Billionaire David Tepper Bought More Shares of This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock That Could Join Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia in the $3 Trillion Club by 2030
articles.author: Prosper Junior Bakiny
articles.summary: David Tepper increased his stake in Meta Platforms in the first quarter. The company's AI-related work is already producing results, but the best is yet to come. It plans to invest hundreds of billions of dollars in AI infrastructure in the coming years. It needs to record a compound annual growth rate of 13.4% in the next five years to become a $3 trillion company.

articles.title: When your LLM calls the cops: Claude 4's whistle-blow and the new agentic AI risk stack
articles.author: Venture Beat
articles.summary: Claude 4's surprise shows why agentic AI risk lives in prompts and tool access, not benchmarks. Learn the 6 controls every enterprise must adopt to prevent AI from being dangerous to humans.      Â   iReport.com:

articles.title: The future of A-I and work
articles.author: Matt O'Donnell
articles.summary: This Sunday, Matt O'Donnell and the Panel discuss the future of AI and the workforce. Many recent college graduates could lose entry level jobs to AI and robotics. Other topics include more alarming statistics about youth and social media and who's in the lead for the upcoming New Jersey Gubernatorial primary.

articles.title: Microsoft wants to radically change the way you surf the web
articles.summary: Microsoft sees artificial intelligence transforming the internet as fundamentally as mobile phones have over the past two decades. The technology's limitations could curb Microsoft's grand vision, however, as it's not as powerful as Microsoft's vision.  Read more at: http://www.businessinsider.com/article/Microsoft-seeks-artificial-intelligence-transforming-the-internet-technologies-could-curb-Microsoft's-grand vision.

articles.title: AI Art Attracts Young Collectors
articles.author: thekatynews
articles.summary: Christie's auction house presented the first sale dedicated solely to art produced using Artificial Intelligence with total sales of $728,784. The sale took place only online and was a success with 34 lots offered up for bid. It attracted art collectors and buyers in the Millennial and Gen Z demographic groups. Today's young collectors collect differently than other collectors. They seek out contemporary art in general and graffiti art.

articles.title: AIIMS-P to use AI-powered diagnostic equipment to improve patient care
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Patna, has entered into a partnership with the e-health section of the ministry of health and family welfare to develop artificial intelligence (AI) powered solutions. It has recently entered into an agreement with the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

articles.title: Announcing Balaji Karumanchi as Founder & CEO of Excelhire – The AI-Agentic Hiring Intelligence Platform
articles.summary: Balaji Karumanchi is the Founder and Chief Executive Officer of Excelhire. Excelhire is the world's first AI-powered hiring intelligence platform. It's powered by a system of intelligent agents that operate 24/7 to empower recruiters and streamline workflows.

articles.title: Inside Google's plan to have Hollywood make AI look less doomsday
articles.summary: Stanley Kubrick, James Cameron and Alex Garland have cast artificial intelligence as a villain that can turn into a killing machine for decades in their movies. The movie "Aristotle" is one of the most famous examples of this kind of film-making.

articles.title: Gen Z is increasingly turning to ChatGPT for affordable on-demand therapy, but licensed therapists say there are dangers many aren't considering
articles.author: Marco Quiroz-Gutierrez
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot that claims to be an effective therapy tool. It's available for a fraction of the price compared to human therapists. Licensed therapists warn ChatGPT can't replace a licensed professional. Some AI algorithms have provided misinformation or harmful information that reinforces stereotypes.

articles.title: AI education is vital for Washington. Trump's order will help
articles.author: Sebastian Griffin
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on AI education on April 23. The order implements a federal AI education framework for all K-12 schools and fast-tracks grant programs. It also creates a federal task force, holds student competitions, fosters industry collaboration and promotes cross-sector collaboration. Mountain States Policy Center's Sebastian Griffin believes the region can make the most of the federal push.

articles.title: Nara University & AI: Vampire-Themed Education Program
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Nara University offers an interdisciplinary AI-Vampire themed education program. The program unites technology, history, literature, and ethics to give students practical skills in the tech world. It has been popular with students wanting a job at the end of their studies.

articles.title: Gmail Gemini AI: Automated Email Summaries
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: Gmail's new AI-powered email summary feature will be fully deployed to Workspace users within the next two weeks. Users can turn off the 'smart feature' option in the Gmail app settings to prevent the AI-generated summaries from being displayed at the top of the message.

articles.title: Fortnite Bot Lobbies 2025: How to Find & Join Now!
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: There are more than 3.5 million players in Fortnite. Bot lobbies in the game are filled with AI-controlled opponents, rather than human players. For newcomers, they provide a crucial onboarding experience. Experienced players use them for leveling up, completing challenges, or just enjoying a casual gaming session.

articles.title: 5 Ways To Use AI To Earn and Save an Extra $100,000 for Retirement
articles.author: G. Brian Davis
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is getting smarter and more flexible in taking over tasks for you. Try these ways to use AI to save an extra $100,000 for retirement. Learn how to advance your career and earn more. Dustin W. Scout runs AI platform Magai and offers an example of a user running a side hustle with nothing but AI support.

articles.title: Secret OpenAI Memo Describes Plans to Make Users Rely on "Entity"
articles.summary: An internal OpenAI document was found in the discovery process for an antitrust trial against Google. It details the company's plans to develop ChatGPT into a super-assistant. The product hasn't yet reached the capabilities that OpenAI's leadership is envisioning. If the company wants to succeed, it will need to overcome its weaknesses.

articles.title: Perspective: Colorado's AI Crossroads
articles.author: Vanessa Rutledge
articles.summary: Gov. Jared Polis supported the 10-year moratorium on state regulation of artificial intelligence. The House of Representatives passed it as an amendment to the 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act'. Colorado was the first state in the nation to attempt to regulate artificial intelligence through the passage of SB24-205 in 2024. Polis expressed serious concerns about its scope and consequences, warning of 'unintended consequences associated with its implementation' and calling for the law to be revised before taking effect on February 1, 2026. The state legislature failed to act and adjourned on May 7, leaving a deeply flawed law on the books.

articles.title: People Still Matter in the Age of AI
articles.author: ROWENA CROSBIE
articles.summary: As AI takes over tasks, people need to double down on other things. People are not less important than before, they are more essential. In times of disruption, people don't crave automation, they crave authentic connection. In a world where automation can do almost anything, it is still the human moments that matter most.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on D-Wave Quantum (QBTS): 'Of the Ones That Are Out There, This is the Best'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: D-Wave Quantum Inc. (NYSE:QBTS) provides quantum computing systems, software, and cloud-based services. Cramer is wary of the company, which has $9 million in revenues over the last 12 months and big losses. QBTS ranks 10th on our list of stocks that Jim Cramer discusses.

articles.title: Is it me or ChatGPT? As AI grows smarter, I have a down-to-earth worry: my job.
articles.author: Ingrid Jacques
articles.summary: As an opinion columnist, Ingrid Jacques is worried about the rise of artificial intelligence and its potential to replace human workers. The Los Angeles Times has started offering online readers the option to read AI-generated counterpoints to the opinion columns it runs. Chicago Sun-Times and Philadelphia Inquirer ran a syndicated summer book list with books that didn't exist.

articles.title: National AI computing center loses momentum amid profitability concerns
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: The government project to establish a national artificial intelligence (AI) computing center is at risk of stalling, as the bidding process to select an operator ended without a single applicant. The government plans to reopen bidding on the project.   Â

articles.title: ChatGPT is making us weird
articles.author: Katherine Tangalakis-Lippert
articles.summary: Chatbots like OpenAI's ChatGPT are changing the way we interact with each other. Business Insider spoke to a range of professionals to find out if AI is disrupting our social cues and intimate lives. The professionals said similar conclusions could be drawn for Meta AI, Microsoft Copilot, Anthropic's Claude.

articles.title: 2 ‘grossly underestimated' skills that will be valuable in the next era of engineering, according to Cisco's CPO
articles.summary: Cisco has 27,000 engineers and is hiring more. Jeetu Patel, the company's president and chief product officer, told Business Insider that AI advancements will redefine the role of engineers in the future. The speed at which an idea becomes a product will go from months to minutes.

articles.title: 2 'grossly underestimated' skills that will be valuable in the next era of engineering, according to Cisco's CPO
articles.author: Ana Altchek
articles.summary: Cisco has 27,000 engineers and is "unapologetically hiring" more. Jeetu Patel, the company's president and chief product officer, told Business Insider that AI advancements will redefine the role of engineers in the future. He said having a strong skillset in agent workflow and idea quality is "grossly underestimated" in the next five years.

articles.title: 2 'grossly underestimated' skills that will be valuable in the next era of engineering, according to Cisco's CPO
articles.summary: Cisco has 27,000 engineers and is "unapologetically hiring" more. Jeetu Patel, the company's president and chief product officer, told Business Insider that AI automation tools are reshaping the role of engineers. Having a strong skillset in agent workflow and idea quality is "grossly underestimated" in the future, Patel said.

articles.title: Was Trump assassination attempt real or staged?
articles.summary: Chat GPT analyzes Trump's alleged assassination attempt. It claims that Trump suffered from an AR-15 grazing wound. The CIA has lied about it's activities since it's inception. Four Secret Service agents were involved in the planning of the Kennedy assassination. Sean Curran was the head of Donald Trump's personal security detail during the assassination attempt in Pennsylvania.

articles.title: Commentary: We regulate taco carts more than artificial intelligence
articles.author: Lionel Levine
articles.summary: The RAISE Act would require the largest AI developers to implement and publish safety plans to protect against the most severe risks. It would also make sure that companies aren't grading their own homework, protect whistleblowers, and authorize the attorney general to hold companies accountable when they release AI systems that pose unreasonably high risks.

articles.title: China Building Millions of Child Sex Robots To Ship to Pedophiles in Western Countries
articles.author: Sean
articles.summary: China is mass-producing millions of child sex robots equipped with AI chatbots. The biggest market for them is reportedly in the US and Canada. Most of the clients are 40 to 50-year-old men from Europe and the US. US customers like dolls with darker skin and large breasts, buttocks and genitals, while Chinese customers go for Asian features with small, hairless genitals.

articles.title: Mind-Bending New Inventions That Artificial General Intelligence Might Discover For The Sake Of Humanity
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Artificial general intelligence (AGI) might be the greatest inventor ever. Here are some inventions that might arise and a timeline. An AI insider scoop is also included.    i.e. a timeline with some inventions and an AI insider's scoop.

articles.title: This artificial intelligence AIM stock trades with an EV-to-EBITDA of just 4x!
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: Celebrus Technologies (LSE:CLBS) is an AIM stock with operations spanning artificial intelligence (AI), data capture and analysis, and cybersecurity. AI stocks in the US often command eye-watering valuations, with enterprise valuations.

articles.title: Why this leading AI CEO is warning the tech could cause mass unemployment
articles.summary: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei is warning that AI could cause a dramatic spike in unemployment in the near future. He says policymakers and corporate leaders aren't ready for it. He believes the AI tools that Anthropic and other companies are building could eliminate half of entry-level, white-collar jobs and spike unemployment to as much as 20% in the next one to five years.

articles.title: An AI bot might be asking the questions at your next job interview
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Some companies are using artificial intelligence to streamline their recruitment processes. Wafa Shafiq had a job interview conducted by an AI bot for a marketing position at a retirement insurance agency. Maureen Green had an interview for a position in a Canadian health-care company that uses AI to direct patient calls. She didn't get a followup after the interview.

articles.title: Editorial: The world promised by AI isn't necessarily a better one
articles.author: The Editorial Board
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is reshaping human beings' relationship with the world and with each other. The benefits and dangers of AI could be greater than for any previous technological development. They urge caution in the further development of AI, strict application of safety standards and generous use of government regulatory power. They support plans to make Pittsburgh a hub for ethical research, development and deployment of AI.

articles.title: Does AI Make Technology More Accessible Or Widen Digital Inequalities?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Will AI advancements supercharge access to technology or create new barriers for people with disabilities? Will they be better for them or just create new ones for others?   Â. Â   yi.yi. yi yi

articles.title: Prediction: This Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Could Be the Next Great Value Play
articles.author: Will Healy
articles.summary: Alphabet is a member of the "Magnificent Seven" value stocks in artificial intelligence (AI). It sells at a 19 P/E ratio, which makes it the cheapest stock in the list. The company's business model is uncertain, but it has invested heavily in AI technology and has a lot of resources.

articles.title: Will Human Error Hand AI the Key to Our Destruction? › American Greatness
articles.author: Julio Rivera
articles.summary: AI-powered cyberattacks are becoming disturbingly common and alarmingly sophisticated. Nearly 95% of cybersecurity breaches are caused by human error. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is running with fewer hands, and budget cuts threaten stretched-thin federal cyber teams. It's time for individuals and private entities to shoulder the digital shield.

articles.title: Attorney General warns parents of AI chatbots, more Health Headlines
articles.author: Jace Di Cola
articles.summary: Last week, Colorado Attorney General Phil Weiser issued a consumer alert regarding a 'sharp rise' in risky youth behaviors encouraged by social AI chatbots. Last October, a popular social chatbot platform (Character.AI) found itself the target of a wrongful death lawsuit after a 14-year-old boy committed suicide, allegedly encouraged by a chatbot based on the Game of Thrones character Daenerys Targaryen. Some Khee Trading products, including frozen, raw and half-shell oysters have been recalled due to concerns they could be contaminated with norovirus.

articles.title: Neural Rendering Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI Model Bypasses Traditional Rendering, Creating Images Directly From Scene Triangles. How RenderFormer Redefines Image Creation, Key Features of RenderFormer, RenderFormer's Technical Architecture, The Impact On Industries and Advantages Of RenderFormer Over Traditional Methods are listed in the table of contents.

articles.title: Neural Rendering of Triangle Meshes with Global Illumination
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: RenderFormer is a new AI model that bypasses the need for per-scene fine-tuning and generates images directly from the scene. It uses a Sequence-To-Sequence Transformation to transform triangle data into pixel data using token sequences. The Transformer Architecture of RenderFormer was developed for Natural Language Processing and has found applications in various fields, including Image Recognition, Rendering, and Architectural Visualization.

articles.title: Transformer Archives
articles.author: Alexandra Hartman
articles.summary: AI Model Bypasses Traditional Rendering, Creating Images Directly From Scene Triangles. How RenderFormer Redefines Image Creation, Key Features of RenderFormer, RenderFormer's Technical Architecture, The Impact On Industries and Advantages Of RenderFormer Over Traditional Methods are listed in the table of contents.

How RenderFormer Redefines Image Creation, Key Features of RenderFormer, RenderFormer's Technical Architecture, The Impact On Industries and Advantages Of RenderFormer Over Traditional Methods are listed in the table of contents.

articles.title: Demand for AI professionals in India projected to touch 1 million by 2026: Report
articles.author: Live Mint
articles.summary: India is poised to see a surge in demand for Artificial Intelligence (AI) professionals, especially in the country's tech-savvy youth.      Â   i.e. in India's IT industry, especially. in the field of AI.

articles.title: TRU eyes opportunity with two AI data centres in works for Kamloops campus
articles.author: Michael Potestio
articles.summary: Bell Canada is rolling out a network of new AI data centres across Canada with iTel, starting with a supercluster of six in B.C., including a soon-to-be facility off Mission Flats Road and two 26-megawatt centres at Thompson Rivers University. One of the data centres at TRU is expected to come online next spring, with a second one the following year. Bell is also partnering with TRU to develop training programs for AI research, computer science and trades.

articles.title: No sanction imposed; judge criticized the error as a 'disgrace'
articles.summary: Paris research fellow Damien Charlotin is compiling misuse of AI from legal decisions around the world. The database tracks legal decisions in cases where AI produced hallucinated content. It's a simple page with columns for jurisdiction, outcomes, professional sanctions, any monetary penalty, and whether the offender was a lawyer or a non-lawyer acting as their own counsel.

articles.title: AI Prompt Evaluators (Slovak)

articles.title: Apple's 'Big AI' problem that Google, Microsoft and Amazon do not have to deal with
articles.author: TOI Tech Desk
articles.summary: Google has a decades-long head start in AI technology. Google controls the deep stack of technologies powering its AI building blocks -- data, chips, data centres, cloud business and means to disseminate the products. Both Microsoft and Amazon have some of these building blocks, including AI models, cloud infrastructure, dedicated AI units working on the technology and even partnerships. Apple lacks many of these assets and doesn't have this kind of access or infrastructure. Apple is also about 7 years behind Google in developing AI chips for data centers. Apple has access to huge volumes of data from its devices but conservative in using that data for AI training.

articles.title: IIT-Bombay leads push for India-centric AI
articles.author: Hindustan Times

articles.author: John W. Whitehead

articles.title: Stop AI Crime: Protect Yourself Now

articles.title: What Leaders Should Know When AI Agents Show More Empathy Than They Do

It is to sense the zeitgeist, the field, the emerging future, the collective unconscious, God-Source, the Way, or universal Mind. When leaders operate from this state, they propagate a sense of connection for the whole, for example in businesses that take care of the environment and social systems that help people thrive.

articles.title: Hey chatbot, is this true? AI 'factchecks' sow misinformation
articles.author: Lionel BONAVENTURE
articles.summary: As misinformation exploded during India's four-day conflict with Pakistan, social media users turned to an AI chatbot for verification, only to encounter more falsehoods. With tech platforms reducing human fact-checkers, users are increasingly relying on AI-powered chatbots in search of reliable information.

articles.title: Hey chatbot, is this true? AI 'factchecks' sow misinformation

Users are increasingly relying on AI-powered chatbots, including xAI's Grok, OpenAI's ChatGPT, and Google's Gemini.
